intro: Taverniera brevialata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved taverniera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
